lead_paragraph: Third-seeded David Nalbandian rallied to defeat Agustin Calleri, 1-6, 7-6 (2), 6-3, in an all-Argentine matchup in the second round of the Barcelona Open in Spain. The wild-card entrant Mario Ancic beat seventh-seeded Andy Murray, 6-4, 6-4. Rafael Nadal, the three-time tournament champion, opens against Potito Starace on Wednesday. Nadal won his fourth straight Monte Carlo Masters title last week.
